required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact Of Viagra On Sexual Satisfaction Of Men With Mild Erectile Dysfunction Who Are Sexually Dissatisfied
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-Center, Parallel Group, Flexible Dose Trial With A Double-Blind, Randomized, Placebo-Controlled Phase Followed By An Open-Label Phase To Assess The Impact Of Viagra On The Sexual Satisfaction Of Men With Mild Erectile Dysfunction

brief_summary.textblock: Men's quality of life (QoL) is potentially affected by mild erectile dysfunction (ED) to the same extent as it is by moderate and severe ED. This study will provide controlled clinical data measuring efficacy, QoL parameters and satisfaction changes in men with mild ED treated with Viagra versus those treated with a placebo. With an open-label extension, this study will also provide all study subjects the opportunity to receive the active drug treatment for 6 weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: Erectile Dysfunction Inventory of Treatment Satisfaction (EDITS) Index at the End of the DB Treatment (Week 8)
primary_outcome.description: adjusted mean : Possible scores for the EDITS Index range from 0 (extremely low treatment satisfaction) to 100 (extremely high treatment satisfaction).

secondary_outcome.measure: Erectile Dysfunction Inventory of Treatment Satisfaction (EDITS) Index
secondary_outcome.description: Possible scores for the EDITS Index range from 0 (extremely low treatment satisfaction) to 100 (extremely high treatment satisfaction).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Double-Blind Phase (Week 8) in Patient Reported Erectile Function Assessment (PREFA) Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: adjusted mean change; PREFA Total Score: 8 = worst; 32 = best.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Reported Erectile Function Assessment (PREFA) Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: PREFA Total Score: 8 = worst, 32 = best.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of DB Phase (Week 8) in International Index of Erectile Function (IIEF) Domain Scores- Erectile Function
secondary_outcome.description: adjusted mean change - Possible total scores for IIEF-EF range from 1 (worst) to 30 (best).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of DB Phase (Week 8) in International Index of Erectile Function (IIEF) Domain Scores- Orgasmic Function
secondary_outcome.description: adjusted mean change - Possible total scores for IIEF-OF range from 0 (worst) to 10 (best).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of DB Phase (Week 8) in International Index of Erectile Function (IIEF) Domain Scores- Sexual Desire
secondary_outcome.description: adjusted mean change - Possible total scores for IIEF-SD range from 2 (worst) to 10 (best).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of DB Phase (Week 8) in International Index of Erectile Function (IIEF) Domain Scores- Intercourse Satisfaction
secondary_outcome.description: adjusted mean - Possible total scores for IIEF-IS range from 0 (worst) to 15 (best).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of DB Phase (Week 8) in International Index of Erectile Function (IIEF) Domain Scores- Overall Satisfaction
secondary_outcome.description: adjusted mean change - Possible total scores for IIEF-OS range from 2 (worst) to 10 (best).

secondary_outcome.measure: International Index of Erectile Function (IIEF) Domain Scores- Erectile Function
secondary_outcome.description: Possible total scores for IIEF-EF range from 1 (worst) to 30 (best).

secondary_outcome.measure: International Index of Erectile Function (IIEF) Domain Scores- Orgasmic Function
secondary_outcome.description: Possible total scores for IIEF-OF range from 0 (worst) to 10 (best).

secondary_outcome.measure: International Index of Erectile Function (IIEF) Domain Scores- Sexual Desire
secondary_outcome.description: Possible total scores for IIEF-SD and IIEF-OS range from 2 (worst) to 10 (best).

secondary_outcome.measure: International Index of Erectile Function (IIEF) Domain Scores- Intercourse Satisfaction
secondary_outcome.description: Possible total scores for IIEF-IS range from 0 (worst) to 15 (best).

secondary_outcome.measure: International Index of Erectile Function (IIEF) Domain Scores- Overall Satisfaction
secondary_outcome.description: Possible total scores for IIEF-SD and IIEF-OS range from 2 (worst) to 10 (best).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of DB Phase (Week 8) in Erectile Distress Scale (EDS) Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: adjusted mean change - Possible total scores for EDS range from 5 (all of the time) to 30 (none of the time). Higher scores indicate less impact of ED.

secondary_outcome.measure: Erectile Distress Scale (EDS) Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: Possible total scores for EDS range from 5 (all of the time) to 30 (none of the time). Higher scores indicate less impact of ED.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of DB Phase (Week 8) in Quality of Erection Questionnaire (QEQ) Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: adjusted mean change - QEQ raw total score (defined as the sum of scores from QEQ Questions 1 and 3 to 7 and ranged from 6 to 30) was transformed to QEQ total score on a scale of 0 (lowest) to 100 (highest).

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of Erection Questionnaire (QEQ) Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: QEQ raw total score (defined as the sum of scores from QEQ Questions 1 and 3 to 7 and ranged from 6 to 30) was transformed to QEQ total score on a scale of 0 (lowest) to 100 (highest).

secondary_outcome.measure: Global Efficacy Question 1 (GEQ1) Response at End of the Double-Blind Phase (Week 8) and at End of the Open-Label Phase (Week 14)
secondary_outcome.description: GEQ 1: Compared to having no treatment at all for your erection problem, has the medication you have been taking over the past 4 weeks improved your erections?Responder was defined as answering "Yes". % of responders/non-responders was calculated based on subjects who attempted intercourse.

secondary_outcome.measure: Global Efficacy Question 2 (GEQ2) Response at End of the Double-Blind Phase (Week 8) and at End of the Open-Label Phase (Week 14)
secondary_outcome.description: GEQ 2: Compared to having no treatment at all for your erection problem, has the medication you have been taking over the past 4 weeks improved your ability to have sexual intercourse? Responder was defined as answering "Yes". % of responders/non-responders was calculated based on subjects who attempted intercourse.

secondary_outcome.measure: Global Efficacy Question 3 (GEQ3) Response at End of the Double-Blind Phase (Week 8) and at End of the Open-Label Phase (Week 14)
secondary_outcome.description: GEQ 3: When you took a dose of study drug and had sexual stimulation, how often did you get an erection that allowed you to engage in satisfactory sexual intercourse? Resp. was defined as answering almost always or always, most times, or sometimes, and non-resp was defined as answering a few times or almost never or never.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Occasions of Successful Intercourse (Event Log)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of occasions at which subjects answered yes to the question, did your erection last long enough to have successful intercourse. Calculation for each subject for each event log endpoint: percentage = (number of occasions with an answer of 'Yes' within visit interval) / (number of occasions within visit interval) x 100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Occasions of Ejaculation and/or Orgasm (Event Log)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of occasions at which subjects answered yes to the question, did your erection last long enough to have successful intercourse. Calculation for each subject for each event log endpoint: percentage = (number of occasions with an answer of 'Yes' within visit interval) / (number of occasions within visit interval) x 100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Occasions of Successful Intercourse (Event Log)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of occasions at which subjects answered yes to the question, did your erection last long enough to have successful intercourse. Calculation for each subject for each event log endpoint: percentage = (number of occasions with an answer of 'Yes' within visit interval) / (number of occasions within visit interval) x 100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Occasions of Ejaculation and/or Orgasm Event Log
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of occasions at which subjects answered yes to the question, did your erection last long enough to have successful intercourse. Calculation for each subject for each event log endpoint: percentage = (number of occasions with an answer of 'Yes' within visit interval) / (number of occasions within visit interval) x 100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 8 in Analog Scales- Firmness
secondary_outcome.description: mean change - scale of 0 (worst) to 10 (best).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 8 in Analog Scales- Maintenance
secondary_outcome.description: mean change - scale of 0 (worst) to 10 (best).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 8 in Analog Scales- Reliability
secondary_outcome.description: mean change - scale of 0 (worst) to 10 (best).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 8 in Analog Scales- General Sexual Performance
secondary_outcome.description: mean change - scale of 0 (worst) to 10 (best)

secondary_outcome.measure: Analog Scales- Firmness
secondary_outcome.description: mean - scale of 0 (worst) to 10 (best)

secondary_outcome.measure: Analog Scales- Maintenance
secondary_outcome.description: mean - scale of 0 (worst) to 10 (best)

secondary_outcome.measure: Analog Scales- Reliability
secondary_outcome.description: mean - scale of 0 (worst) to 10 (best)

secondary_outcome.measure: Analog Scales- General Sexual Performance
secondary_outcome.description: mean - scale of 0 (worst) to 10 (best)

secondary_outcome.measure: Shift in Responder Rate From Week 8 to Week 14 for Global Efficacy Question (GEQ) 1
secondary_outcome.description: GEQ 1: Compared to having no treatment at all for your erection problem, has the medication you have been taking over the past 4 weeks improved your erections? Responder was defined as answering Yes to GEQ 1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Shift in Responder Rate From Week 8 to Week 14 for GEQ2
secondary_outcome.description: GEQ 2: Compared to having no treatment at all for your erection problem, has the medication you have been taking over the past 4 weeks improved your ability to have sexual intercourse? Responder was defined as answering Yes to GEQ 2.

secondary_outcome.measure: Shift in Responder Rate From Week 8 to Week 14 for GEQ3
secondary_outcome.description: GEQ3: When you took a dose of study drug and had sexual stimulation, how often did you get an erection that allowed you to engage in satisfactory sexual intercourse? Responder = almost always or always, most times, or sometimes. Non-responder = a few times (much less than half the time) or almost never or never.

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline to <Week 8 and Week 8 to <=Week 14 in Event Log: Hardness of First Erections Grade 0
secondary_outcome.description: Per-patient percentage of hardness of erections:Grade 0 = no erection at all. Calculation for each subject for each event log endpoint: percentage = (number of occasions with an answer of 'Yes' within visit interval) / (number of occasions within visit interval) x 100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline to <Week 8 and Week 8 to <=Week 14 in Event Log: Hardness of First Erections Grade 1
secondary_outcome.description: Per-patient percentage of hardness of erections: Grade 1 = increase in size but not hard. Calculation for each subject for each event log endpoint: percentage = (number of occasions with an answer of 'Yes' within visit interval) / (number of occasions within visit interval) x 100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline to <Week 8 and Week 8 to <=Week 14 in Event Log: Hardness of First Erections Grade 2
secondary_outcome.description: Per-patient percentage of hardness of erections: Grade 2 = hard but not hard enough for penetration. Calculation for each subject for each event log endpoint: percentage = (number of occasions with an answer of 'Yes' within visit interval) / (number of occasions within visit interval) x 100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline to <Week 8 and Week 8 to <=Week 14 in Event Log: Hardness of First Erections Grade 3
secondary_outcome.description: Per-patient percentage of hardness of erections: Grade 3 = hard enough for penetration but not completely hard. Calculation for each subject for each event log endpoint: percentage = (number of occasions with an answer of 'Yes' within visit interval) / (number of occasions within visit interval) x 100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline to <Week 8 and Week 8 to <=Week 14 in Event Log: Hardness of First Erections Grade 4
secondary_outcome.description: Per-patient percentage of hardness of erections: Grade 4 = completely hard. Calculation for each subject for each event log endpoint: percentage = (number of occasions with an answer of 'Yes' within visit interval) / (number of occasions within visit interval) x 100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline to <Week 8 and Week 8 to <=Week 14 in Event Log: Hardness of First Erections Grade 3 or 4
secondary_outcome.description: Per-patient percentage of hardness of erections: Grade 3 = hard enough for penetration but not completely hard, Grade 4 = completely hard. Calculation for each subject for each event log endpoint: percentage = (number of occasions with an answer of 'Yes' within visit interval) / (number of occasions within visit interval) x 100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline to <Week 8 and Week 8 to <=Week 14 in Event Log: Hardness of Second Erections Grade 0
secondary_outcome.description: Per-patient percentage of hardness of second erections: Grade 0 = no erection at all. Calculation for each subject for each event log endpoint: percentage = (number of occasions with an answer of 'Yes' within visit interval) / (number of occasions within visit interval) x 100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline to <Week 8 and Week 8 to <=Week 14 in Event Log: Hardness of Second Erections Grade 1
secondary_outcome.description: Per-patient percentage of hardness of second erections: Grade 1 = increase in size but not hard. Calculation for each subject for each event log endpoint: percentage = (number of occasions with an answer of 'Yes' within visit interval) / (number of occasions within visit interval) x 100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline to <Week 8 and Week 8 to <=Week 14 in Event Log: Hardness of Second Erections Grade 2
secondary_outcome.description: Per-patient percentage of hardness of second erections:Grade 2 = hard but not hard enough for penetration. Calculation for each subject for each event log endpoint: percentage = (number of occasions with an answer of 'Yes' within visit interval) / (number of occasions within visit interval) x 100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline to <Week 8 and Week 8 to <=Week 14 in Event Log: Hardness of Second Erections Grade 3
secondary_outcome.description: Per-patient percentage of hardness of second erections:Grade 3 = hard enough for penetration but not completely hard. Calculation for each subject for each event log endpoint: percentage = (number of occasions with an answer of 'Yes' within visit interval) / (number of occasions within visit interval) x 100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline to <Week 8 and Week 8 to <=Week 14 in Event Log: Hardness of Second Erections Grade 4
secondary_outcome.description: Per-patient percentage of hardness of second erections:Grade 4 = completely hard. Calculation for each subject for each event log endpoint: percentage = (number of occasions with an answer of 'Yes' within visit interval) / (number of occasions within visit interval) x 100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline to <Week 8 and Week 8 to <=Week 14 in Event Log: Hardness of Second Erections Grade 3 or 4
secondary_outcome.description: Per-patient percentage of hardness of second erections: Grade 3 = hard enough for penetration but not completely hard, Grade 4 = completely hard. Calculation for each subject for each event log endpoint: percentage = (number of occasions with an answer of 'Yes' within visit interval) / (number of occasions within visit interval) x 100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline to <Week 8 and Week 8 to <=Week 14 in Event Log: Frequency of Second Erections
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of occasions at which second erection was achieved. Calculation for each subject for each event log endpoint: percentage = (number of occasions with an answer of 'Yes' within visit interval) / (number of occasions within visit interval) x 100.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men above age of majority
- Mild erectile dysfunction (IIEF-EF 22-25) and sexual dissatisfaction (IIEF-OS 7 or less)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Use of more than 4 doses of any PDE5 inhibitor in the past 12 weeks and use of any PDE5 inhibitor in the past 4 weeks
- Subjects currently taking any other commercially available drug or non-drug treatment for ED

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 183 subjects entered the study, and 176 subjects were treated in the Double Blind (DB) phase. One subject completed DB phase and continued into the open-label (OL) phase but had no events of sexual activity and therefore, did not take study drug and was excluded from the number of treated subjects, the safety analysis set, and PP population.

group.title: DB Viagra / OL Viagra
group.description: Subjects started double-blind phase on 50 mg Viagra. After 2 weeks, subjects were allowed to titrate the dose (up or down) depending on efficacy and tolerability and remained on that dose until the end of the double-blind phase (after 8 weeks). Subjects started open-label phase on 50 mg Viagra. After 2 weeks of treatment, subjects were allowed to titrate the dose (up or down) depending on efficacy and tolerability and remained on that dose until the end of open-label phase (after 6 weeks).

group.title: DB Placebo/OL Viagra
group.description: Subjects started double-blind phase on matching placebo. After 2 weeks, subjects were allowed to titrate the dose (up or down) depending on efficacy and tolerability and remained on that dose until the end of double-blind phase (after 8 weeks). Subjects started open-label phase on 50 mg Viagra. After 2 weeks of treatment, subjects were allowed to titrate the dose (up or down) depending on efficacy and tolerability and remained on that dose until the end of open-label phase (after 6 weeks).

group.title: Start : DB Viagra
group.description: Subjects started double-blind phase on 50 mg Viagra. After 2 weeks, subjects were allowed to titrate the dose (up or down) depending on efficacy and tolerability and remained on that dose until the end of the double-blind phase (after 8 weeks).

group.title: Start : DB Placebo
group.description: Subjects started double-blind phase on matching placebo. After 2 weeks, subjects were allowed to titrate the dose (up or down) depending on efficacy and tolerability and remained on that dose until the end of double-blind phase (after 8 weeks).

measure.title: Age
measure.description: DB Viagra/OL Viagra=52.2+/-12.1(n=83) DB Placebo/OL Viagra=48.4+/-12.2(n=69)

measure.title: Sex: Female, Male
measure.description: DB Viagra/OL Viagra Male/Female=83/0 DB Placebo/OL Viagra Male/Female=69/0

outcome.title: Erectile Dysfunction Inventory of Treatment Satisfaction (EDITS) Index at the End of the DB Treatment (Week 8)
outcome.description: adjusted mean : Possible scores for the EDITS Index range from 0 (extremely low treatment satisfaction) to 100 (extremely high treatment satisfaction).
outcome.population: number of subjects in the Full Analysis Set (FAS) population with an observation

measure.title: Erectile Dysfunction Inventory of Treatment Satisfaction (EDITS) Index at the End of the DB Treatment (Week 8)
measure.description: adjusted mean : Possible scores for the EDITS Index range from 0 (extremely low treatment satisfaction) to 100 (extremely high treatment satisfaction).
measure.population: number of subjects in the Full Analysis Set (FAS) population with an observation

analysis.groups_desc: The primary analysis population was the FAS. The sample size was estimated based on an expected difference of 16.5 with a standard deviation of 28.4, based on previously observed data.
analysis.p_value_desc: Since there was only one primary endpoint no multiple comparison adjustments were made for primary analysis. Final stat. model included centre, treatment, smoking status and history of ED as factors, and age, duration of ED (baseline) as covariates.
analysis.estimate_desc: Mean difference between the sidenafil group compared to the placebo group was calculated along with 95% confidence intervals for these differences.

outcome.title: Erectile Dysfunction Inventory of Treatment Satisfaction (EDITS) Index
outcome.description: Possible scores for the EDITS Index range from 0 (extremely low treatment satisfaction) to 100 (extremely high treatment satisfaction).
outcome.population: number of subjects in the FAS population with an observation

measure.population: number of subjects in the FAS population with an observation

analysis.estimate_desc: A paired t-test was used to examine the within treatment difference between week 8 and week 14 (open label phase).
A paired t-test was used to examine the within treatment difference between week 8 and week 14 (open label phase).

measure.title: Erectile Distress Scale (EDS) Total Score
measure.description: Possible total scores for EDS range from 5 (all of the time) to 30 (none of the time). Higher scores indicate less impact of ED.
measure.population: number of subjects in the FAS population with an observation

analysis.estimate_desc: A paired t-test was used to examine the within treatment difference between week 8 and week 14 (open label phase).

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to End of DB Phase (Week 8) in Quality of Erection Questionnaire (QEQ) Total Score
outcome.description: adjusted mean change - QEQ raw total score (defined as the sum of scores from QEQ Questions 1 and 3 to 7 and ranged from 6 to 30) was transformed to QEQ total score on a scale of 0 (lowest) to 100 (highest).
outcome.population: number of subjects in the FAS population with an observation

measure.description: adjusted mean change - QEQ raw total score (defined as the sum of scores from QEQ Questions 1 and 3 to 7 and ranged from 6 to 30) was transformed to QEQ total score on a scale of 0 (lowest) to 100 (highest).

outcome.title: Global Efficacy Question 1 (GEQ1) Response at End of the Double-Blind Phase (Week 8) and at End of the Open-Label Phase (Week 14)
outcome.description: GEQ 1: Compared to having no treatment at all for your erection problem, has the medication you have been taking over the past 4 weeks improved your erections?Responder was defined as answering ‚ÄúYes‚Äù. % of responders/non-responders was calculated based on subjects who attempted intercourse.
outcome.population: number of subjects in the FAS population with an observation

measure.title: Global Efficacy Question 1 (GEQ1) Response at End of the Double-Blind Phase (Week 8) and at End of the Open-Label Phase (Week 14)
measure.description: GEQ 1: Compared to having no treatment at all for your erection problem, has the medication you have been taking over the past 4 weeks improved your erections?Responder was defined as answering ‚ÄúYes‚Äù. % of responders/non-responders was calculated based on subjects who attempted intercourse.
measure.population: number of subjects in the FAS population with an observation

outcome.title: Global Efficacy Question 2 (GEQ2) Response at End of the Double-Blind Phase (Week 8) and at End of the Open-Label Phase (Week 14)
outcome.description: GEQ 2: Compared to having no treatment at all for your erection problem, has the medication you have been taking over the past 4 weeks improved your ability to have sexual intercourse? Responder was defined as answering ‚ÄúYes‚Äù. % of responders/non-responders was calculated based on subjects who attempted intercourse.
outcome.population: number of subjects in the FAS population with an observation

measure.title: Global Efficacy Question 2 (GEQ2) Response at End of the Double-Blind Phase (Week 8) and at End of the Open-Label Phase (Week 14)
measure.description: GEQ 2: Compared to having no treatment at all for your erection problem, has the medication you have been taking over the past 4 weeks improved your ability to have sexual intercourse? Responder was defined as answering ‚ÄúYes‚Äù. % of responders/non-responders was calculated based on subjects who attempted intercourse.
measure.population: number of subjects in the FAS population with an observation

outcome.title: Global Efficacy Question 3 (GEQ3) Response at End of the Double-Blind Phase (Week 8) and at End of the Open-Label Phase (Week 14)
outcome.description: GEQ 3: When you took a dose of study drug and had sexual stimulation, how often did you get an erection that allowed you to engage in satisfactory sexual intercourse? Resp. was defined as answering almost always or always, most times, or sometimes, and non-resp was defined as answering a few times or almost never or never.
outcome.population: number of subjects in the FAS population with an observation

measure.title: Global Efficacy Question 3 (GEQ3) Response at End of the Double-Blind Phase (Week 8) and at End of the Open-Label Phase (Week 14)
measure.description: GEQ 3: When you took a dose of study drug and had sexual stimulation, how often did you get an erection that allowed you to engage in satisfactory sexual intercourse? Resp. was defined as answering almost always or always, most times, or sometimes, and non-resp was defined as answering a few times or almost never or never.
measure.population: number of subjects in the FAS population with an observation

outcome.title: Percentage of Occasions of Successful Intercourse (Event Log)
outcome.description: Percentage of occasions at which subjects answered yes to the question, did your erection last long enough to have successful intercourse. Calculation for each subject for each event log endpoint: percentage = (number of occasions with an answer of ‚ÄòYes‚Äô within visit interval) / (number of occasions within visit interval) x 100.
outcome.population: number of subjects in the FAS population with an observation

group.title: DB Viagra
group.description: Subjects started double-blind phase on 50 mg Viagra. After 2 weeks, subjects were allowed to titrate the dose (up or down) depending on efficacy and tolerability and remained on that dose until the end of the double-blind phase (after 8 weeks)

group.title: DB Placebo
group.description: Subjects started double-blind phase on matching placebo. After 2 weeks, subjects were allowed to titrate the dose (up or down) depending on efficacy and tolerability and remained on that dose until the end of double-blind phase (after 8 weeks).

measure.title: Percentage of Occasions of Successful Intercourse (Event Log)
measure.description: Percentage of occasions at which subjects answered yes to the question, did your erection last long enough to have successful intercourse. Calculation for each subject for each event log endpoint: percentage = (number of occasions with an answer of ‚ÄòYes‚Äô within visit interval) / (number of occasions within visit interval) x 100.
measure.population: number of subjects in the FAS population with an observation

analysis.estimate_desc: Independent-samples t-test was used to test mean difference of zero between treatment groups (Viagra - Placebo) at each visit interval.

After 2 weeks, subjects were allowed to titrate the dose (up or down) depending on efficacy and tolerability and remained on that dose until the end of the double-blind phase (after 8 weeks). After 2 weeks of treatment, subjects were allowed to titrate the dose (up or down) depending on efficacy and tolerability and remained on that dose until the end of open-label phase (after 6 weeks).

measure.title: Baseline to <Week 8 and Week 8 to <=Week 14 in Event Log: Hardness of Second Erections Grade 0
measure.description: Per-patient percentage of hardness of second erections: Grade 0 = no erection at all. Calculation for each subject for each event log endpoint: percentage = (number of occasions with an answer of ‚ÄòYes‚Äô within visit interval) / (number of occasions within visit interval) x 100.
measure.population: number of subjects in the FAS population with an observation

analysis.estimate_desc: Independent-samples t-test was used to test mean difference of zero between treatment groups (Viagra - Placebo) at each visit interval.
Independent-samples t-test was used to test mean difference of zero between treatment groups (Viagra - Placebo) at each visit interval.

outcome.title: Baseline to <Week 8 and Week 8 to <=Week 14 in Event Log: Hardness of Second Erections Grade 1
outcome.description: Per-patient percentage of hardness of second erections: Grade 1 = increase in size but not hard. outcome.title: Baseline to <Week 8 and Week 8 to <=Week 14 in Event Log: Frequency of Second Erections
outcome.description: Percentage of occasions at which second erection was achieved. Calculation for each subject for each event log endpoint: percentage = (number of occasions with an answer of ‚ÄòYes‚Äô within visit interval) / (number of occasions within visit interval) x 100.
outcome.population: number of subjects in the FAS population with an observation

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of <60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), <12 mo from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential info other than study results.
